.definition: to use something completely so that nothing is left
.example: I've run out of milk.

.definition: to be mindful of or consider something
.example: It was designed bearing in mind environmental impact.

.definition: modern, recent, or containing the latest information
.example: I try to keep up to date.

.definition: in danger of being harmed or damaged, or of dying
.example: There’s no reason to put passers by at risk.

.definition: used to suggest doing something, often when there is nothing better to do
.example: We may as well start the meeting - the others will be here soon.

.definition: happen every day or most days
.example: They carried on with their day to day tasks.

.definition: to be in agreement with
.example: She also said that any restoration must be in line with the original architectural style.

.definition: to give someone the things they need, such as money, food, or clothes
.example: It's hard to make enough money to provide for such a large family.

.definition: make the differences between two things
.example: The weather was by contrast a pleasant surprise.

.definition: As a method or means of doing something.
.example: It was only by way of bribery that they managed.

.definition: a phrase introducing something that should be taken into consideration
.example: Mind you, that’s one reason why I go there.

.definition: Take action according to or in the light of
.example: She never acted on that rage.

.definition: to make something such as a feeling or a quality greater or more extreme
.example: It does nothing to add to the scenery.

.definition: always behaving or happening in a similar, especially positive way
.example: I have decided that the course of conduct which I am following is consistent with my sense of responsibility as president in time of war

.definition: despite everything, for all that
.example: Even so, it’s no way to treat a guest.

.definition: according to a rule
.example: You can in principle.

.definition: not to mention
.example: She can't boil potatoes, let alone cook a meal

.definition: in a way that often happens and is expected
.example: There were definite low points, too.As usual.

.definition: someone or something that is behind the times, not up to date and often no longer considered relevant
.example: He’s just a bit old fashioned sometimes.

.definition: traveling, especially for long distances or periods of time
.example: I can’t wait to get on the road again.

.definition: used to introduce the first item on a list, often used when giving instructions
.example: First of all, I'll introduce the new members in the meeting.

.definition: 30 minutes after any hour
.example: I left the party at 1:00 am and reached home half past that.

.definition: available for purchase; able to be bought
.example: All items in the store are for sale.

.definition: find unexpectedly
.example: I come across you useful site while searching for a hotel near the airport.

.definition: in addition to,alongside
.example: The police, in conjunction with the fire department, managed to keep the crowd under control.

.definition: still; until the present time
.example: I’m not convinced as yet.

.definition: used to emphasize that something is not large or important
.example: It cost a mere 20 dollars.

.definition: proved to exist or be true
.example: Dogs have been shown to help.

.definition: used to introduce a point of view, fact, or situation, followed by another that typically contrasts with it.
.example: On the one hand I'd like a job that pays more, but on the other hand I enjoy the work I'm doing at the moment.

.definition: added as a general reference to other things similar to the thing mentioned
.example: I don’t want any trouble or anything.

.definition: very probably
.example: It is most likely the reason for the warming.

.definition: to indicate something that exists or happens only in a particular place or within a particular group.
.example: The dinner was limited to seniors.

.definition: in my opinion
.example: To me what matters is that it gets done.

.definition: during any one period
.example: I can only do one thing at a time.

.definition: concerning or in relation to something
.example: She had nothing to add with respect to the report.

.definition: somewhere far away
.example: He lives way out in the country.

.definition: a person or group besides the two primarily involved in a situation, especially a dispute.
.example: They work with third party software too.

.definition: conflicting with; counter to
.example: Contrary to his expectations, he found the atmosphere exciting.

.definition: the amount of money that something can be sold for
.example: The estimated worth of her jewels alone is about $30 million.

.definition: this much or more of a specific amount
.example: It’s a good half hour’s walk to the stadium from here.

.definition: used to give a reason why something is not possible or true
.example: The exam went pretty well, except that I misread the final question.

.definition: a long time before/earlier/a
.example: Long before I could quit I was offered a promotion.

.definition: in the distant past.
.example: I gave up on that idea long ago.

.definition: a considerable amount.
.example: My job involves quite a lot of travel.

.definition: used when expressing something in a new or unusual way.
.example: It's a whole new branch of chemistry, a new science if you like

.definition: to emphasize that a situation has reached a difficult, dangerous, or surprising stage.
.example: He’s interesting to the extent that he knows a lot.

.definition: to the extent or point that
.example: So far as I know it’s not the first time either.

.definition: Assuming that; in consideration of the fact that
.example: It was no surprise given that it was her job.

.definition: taking everything into account; in general.
.example: It was acceptable on the whole.

.definition: To be interested in doing a particular action or activity. Often used in the negative to mean the opposite.
.example: No thanks, I don't care to jog today—my legs still hurt from yesterday's trip to the gym
